summary: This document is a series of emails from Christopher J. Dilorio, a self-proclaimed whistleblower, to various judges and SEC officials. He alleges massive, ongoing accounting fraud, securities fraud, and illegal naked short selling by Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT), facilitated by SEC corruption and obstruction. He claims the SEC protects entities like Jefferies and individuals like Ken Griffin while denying his whistleblower claims.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the emails, making extensive allegations of securities fraud, accounting fraud, and SEC corruption related to Knight Capital, KCG, Virtu Financial, and other entities.

persons.name: Ken Griffin
persons.context: Allegedly the owner of CDEL Securities (Citadel), which is accused of being structured to avoid liability for self-clearing accounting fraud. Mentioned in relation to inconsistencies in clearing practices.

persons.name: Doug Cifu
persons.context: CEO of Virtu Financial (VIRT), repeatedly accused of being involved in accounting fraud, misleading disclosures, and threatening analysts. Cited for admissions about retail-driven revenue.

persons.name: Richard Handler
persons.context: CEO of Jefferies, accused of having a corrupt, criminal relationship with the SEC and SDNY, and being a primary beneficiary of frauds related to Knight/KCG/Virtu.

persons.name: Joyce
persons.context: Allegedly joined Knight from Broadcort/Merrill, saw massive fraud from naked shorting, and took Knight self-clear, knowingly misclassifying liabilities as assets.

persons.name: Sean Galvin
persons.context: Described as the third NITE/VIRT CFO in just over a year, accused of keeping the accounting fraud up and running.

persons.name: Dan Kamensky
persons.context: A defendant in a case where Dilorio claims the SEC/SDNY withheld exculpatory evidence. Dilorio's information allegedly led to a plea deal for Kamensky, but he claims Kamensky's life is ruined.

persons.name: Jay Clayton
persons.context: Former SEC Chairman accused of not recusing himself from conflicts related to Sullivan & Cromwell and NITE/VIRT, and of facilitating fraud.

persons.name: Glenn Hutchins
persons.role: Co-founder of Silver Lake, former Blackstone
persons.context: Linked to Blackstone, Silver Lake, and the purchase of SunGard. Co-founded North Island, a top shareholder in NITE/VIRT, alleged to be part of money laundering schemes.

persons.name: Robert Greifeld
persons.context: Former CEO of NASDAQ, previously at SunGard and Automated Securities Clearance. Linked to North Island and alleged self-dealing in the NASDAQ purchase of the BRUT ECN from SunGard.

persons.name: Adena Friedman
persons.context: Current CEO of NASDAQ, signed off on the transaction where NASDAQ bought the BRUT ECN from SunGard.

persons.name: Jared Fishman
persons.context: A Sullivan & Cromwell colleague of Jay Clayton, accused of playing a key role in keeping NITE/VIRT operational and involved in the VIRT/KCG merger.

persons.name: Jane Norberg
persons.role: SEC Official (likely in Office of the Whistleblower)
persons.context: Referred to as 'Norberg', an SEC official accused of creating extraordinary reasons for denying Dilorio's whistleblower award and mishandling his information.

persons.name: Joshie Sason
persons.context: Alleged 'bag man' involved with Hanover/Magna and companies like CGFIA, IMDS, NewLead, etc., detailed in Dilorio's TCRs and subject of an SEC complaint.

persons.name: Justin Keener
persons.context: Alleged 'bag man' with JMJ, detailed in Dilorio's 2013 TCR, involved in money laundering shells like Blink Charging, and barred by FINRA as a 'Bad Actor'.

persons.name: Blostein
persons.context: A Goldman Sachs analyst covering NITE/VIRT, accused of knowing about OTCM share volumes driving revenue but not disclosing it in his models.

persons.name: Repetto
persons.context: A sell-side analyst (Dougie Reppetto), referred to as a 'perma pumper', asked questions on Virtu earnings calls and is implied to have a relationship with Jefferies/Handler.

persons.name: Fannon
persons.context: A sell-side analyst mentioned alongside Repetto, implied to be covering NITE/VIRT for Jefferies.

persons.name: Judge Preska
persons.context: A judge addressed in one of Dilorio's emails regarding naked shorting and SEC corruption.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: A judge addressed regarding the lack of investigation into Dilorio's allegations and the Dan Kamensky case.

persons.name: Judge Cave
persons.context: A judge addressed regarding the corrupt relationship between the SEC and Handler/Jefferies and the Kamensky case.

persons.name: Judge Jones
persons.context: A judge addressed alongside Judge Cave regarding proof of SEC's corrupt relationship with Handler/Jefferies.

persons.name: Janey
persons.context: An SEC official (likely in the Office of the Whistleblower or Enforcement) repeatedly emailed by Dilorio regarding his allegations and award denial.

persons.name: Hoecker
persons.context: The SEC Inspector General, accused by Dilorio of being corrupt and precluded from involvement due to conflicts.

persons.name: Berger
persons.context: An SEC official with whom Dilorio filed his 2013 TCR regarding Knight Capital.

persons.name: Richard Best
persons.context: An SEC NY official who brought a FINRA complaint against Brown Brothers Harriman based on Dilorio's information.

persons.name: Ajay Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, LLC, which was subject to an SEC complaint for pump-and-dump schemes related to Net Element (NETE).

persons.name: Amit Tandon
persons.context: Co-founder of SeeThruEquity, LLC, subject to the same SEC complaint as Ajay Tandon.

connections.description: Dilorio is a whistleblower repeatedly communicating allegations and appeals to SEC official Janey.
Alleged corrupt relationship where Clayton's former firm (Sullivan & Cromwell) had ties to NITE/VIRT, and Handler/Jefferies benefited from SEC actions.
Accused of orchestrating the VIRT/KCG merger and engaging in accounting fraud together, with Handler/Jefferies as a major shareholder.
Both are CEOs of major financial firms (Citadel and Virtu) implicated in similar alleged self-clearing and naked shorting schemes.
Co-founded North Island, a top shareholder in NITE/VIRT, linking former Blackstone and NASDAQ leadership.
Colleagues at Sullivan & Cromwell; Fishman allegedly played a key role in NITE/VIRT operations during Clayton's SEC tenure.
Both are alleged 'bag men' involved in financing and promoting money laundering shell companies, as detailed in Dilorio's TCRs.
Repetto is implied to be a sell-side analyst at Jefferies, covering NITE/VIRT and potentially influenced by Handler.
Handler/Jefferies was the investment bank in the Kamensky case; Dilorio alleges a corrupt relationship between the SEC/SDNY and Handler that harmed Kamensky.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: A trading 'glitch' at Knight Capital that caused massive losses, which Dilorio alleges was a cover-up for insolvency due to illegal naked shorting and accounting fraud.

events.title: VIRT/KCG Merger Closing
events.description: The merger of Virtu Financial and KCG Holdings, which Dilorio alleges was orchestrated by the SEC, Handler, and Cifu using fraudulent balance sheet valuations while KCG was insolvent.

events.title: Virtu Financial Q4 2020 Earnings Call
events.description: Earnings call where Doug Cifu made admissions about retail segment driving revenue, and analysts failed to ask about balance sheet fraud, according to Dilorio.

events.title: Dilorio's Allegation of Ongoing Insolvency
events.description: Dilorio claims that as of this date, NITE/VIRT remains insolvent due to ongoing accounting fraud and illegal naked shorting, posing a risk to the public.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThruEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThruEquity, LLC and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump schemes, which Dilorio links to Net Element (NETE) promotions.

events.title: FINRA Bars Justin Keener/JMJ
events.description: FINRA barred Justin Keener/JMJ as a 'Bad Actor' for failing to comply with requests related to bogus convertible notes and money laundering shell activities.

events.title: GameStop Failed to Deliver Shares
events.description: Bloomberg report cited by Dilorio stating $359 million worth of GameStop shares failed to deliver, used as evidence of ongoing naked shorting issues.

keyFacts: Christopher J. Dilorio alleges a massive, ongoing accounting and securities fraud at Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu Financial (NITE/VIRT) involving illegal naked short selling and the misclassification of liabilities as assets.
He claims the SEC has engaged in criminal obstruction to protect NITE/VIRT, Jefferies (Richard Handler), and other entities, while actively denying his whistleblower claims and awards.

Dilorio asserts that the 2012 Knight 'glitch' and the 2017 VIRT/KCG merger were cover-ups for insolvency caused by the core business of abusive naked shorting of OTCM shells to facilitate money laundering.
He links former SEC Chairman Jay Clayton and his former firm Sullivan & Cromwell (via Jared Fishman) to the corruption, alleging undisclosed conflicts and facilitation of the fraud.

The emails reference a broader ecosystem of alleged fraud involving shell companies, bag men like Joshie Sason and Justin Keener, and money laundering linked to entities like Net Element (NETE), AQR, and Russian mirror trades.
